WSCp MARK 4.2 & he hi fela on bigspellum lærde, & him to cwæð on his lare.
WSCp MARK 4.3 Gehyrað;
Ut eode se sædere his sæd to sawenne.
WSCp MARK 4.4 & þa he sew sum feoll wið þone weg,
& fugelas comon & hit fræton.
WSCp MARK 4.5 Sum feoll ofer stanscyligean þar hit næfde mycele eorðan, & sona up eode, & forþam hit næfde eorþan þiccnesse.
WSCp MARK 4.6 Þa hit upeode, seo sunne hit forswælde,
& hit forscranc, forþam hit wyrtruman næfde.
WSCp MARK 4.7 & sum feoll on þornas,
þa stigon ða þornas & forðrysmodon þæt,
& hit wæstm ne bær.
WSCp MARK 4.8 & sum feoll on god land
& hit sealde uppstigende & wexende wæstm;
& an brohte þritigfealdne, sum syxtigfealdne, sum hundfealdne.
WSCp MARK 4.9 And he cwæð,
gehyre se ðe earan hæbbe to gehyranne.
WSCp MARK 4.10 & þa he ana wæs hine axodon þæt bigspell þa twelfe þe mid him wæron.
WSCp MARK 4.11 & he sæde him,
eow is geseald to witanne Godes rices gerynu;

þam þe ute synt ealle þing on bigspellum gewurþað. WSCp MARK 4.12 Þæt hi geseonde geseon & na ne geseon & gehyrende gehyren & ne ongyten þe læs hi hwænne syn gescyrede, & him sin hyra synna forgyfene.
WSCp MARK 4.13 Ða sæde he him,
ge nyton þis bigspell,
& hu mage ge ealle bigspell witan?
WSCp MARK 4.14 Se þe sæwð, word he sæwð.
WSCp MARK 4.15 Soðlice þa synt wið þone weg þar þæt word is gesawen,
& þonne hi hit gehyrað; Sona cymð Satanas & afyrð þæt word þe on heora heortan asawen ys.
WSCp MARK 4.16 & þa synt gelice þe synt ofer þa stanscylian gesawen;
Sona þænne hi þæt word gehyrað, & þæt mid blisse onfoð.
WSCp MARK 4.17 & hi nabbað wyrtruman on him, ac beoð unstaðolfæste,
& syþþan upcymð deofles costnung & his ehtnys for þam worde.
WSCp MARK 4.18 Hi synd on þornum gesawen,
þæt synd þa ðe þæt word gehyrað. WSCp MARK 4.19 & of yrmðe & swicdome woroldwelene, & oðra gewilnunga þæt word ofþrymsað, & synt buton wæstme gewordene.
WSCp MARK 4.20 & þa ðe gesawene synt ofer þæt gode land, þa synd þe þæt word gehyrað & onfoð, & wæstm bringað, sum þritigfealdne, sum syxtigfealdne, & sum hundfealdne.
WSCp MARK 4.21 He sæde him,
cwyst þu
cymð þæt leohtfæt þæt hit beo under bydene asett, oððe under bedde;
Wite geare þæt hit sy ofer candelstæf asett.
WSCp MARK 4.22 Soðlice nis nan ðing behydd þe ne sy geswutelod;
ne nis digle geworden, ac þæt hit openlice cume.
WSCp MARK 4.23 Gehyre gif hwa earan hæbbe to gehyranne.
WSCp MARK 4.24 & he cwæð to him,
warniað hwæt ge gehyran,
& on þam gemete, þe ge metað eow bið gemeten & eow bið geict.
WSCp MARK 4.25 Þam bið geseald þe hæfð
& þam ðe næfð, eac þæt he hæfð him bið ætbroden.
WSCp MARK 4.26 & he cwæð
Godes rice ys swylce man wurpe god sæd on his land. WSCp MARK 4.27 & sawe & arise dæges & nihtes, & þæt sæd growe & wexe þonne he nat.
WSCp MARK 4.28 Soðlice sylfwilles seo eorðe wæstm berað ærest gærs syððan ear, syþþan fullne hwæte on þam eare.
WSCp MARK 4.29 And þonne se wæstm hine forðbringð, sona he sent his sicol forþam þæt rip æt is.
WSCp MARK 4.30 & eft he cwæð,
for hwam geanlicie we heofena rice,
oððe hwylcum bigspelle wiðmete we hit?
WSCp MARK 4.31 Swa swa senepes sæd,
þonne hit bið on eorðan gesawen, hit is ealra sæda læst þe on eorðan synt.
WSCp MARK 4.32 & þonne hit asawen bið hit astihþ, & bið ealra wyrta mæst & hæfð swa mycele bogas þæt heofenes fugelas eardian magon under his sceade.
WSCp MARK 4.33 & manegum swylcum bigspellum he spræc to him þæt hi mihton gehyran.
WSCp MARK 4.34 Ne spæc he na butan bispelle;
eall he his leorningcnihtum asundron rehte. WSCp MARK 4.35 & sæde him þonne æfen bið
uton faran agen
And þas menigu forlætan, hi onfengon hine swa he on scipe wæs,
& oþre scipu wæron mid him.
WSCp MARK 4.37 & þa wæs mycel yst windes geworden;
& yþa he awearp on þæt scyp þæt hit gefylled wæs.
WSCp MARK 4.38 & he wæs on scipe ofer bolster slapende,
& hi awehton hine & cwædon,
ne belimpð to þe þæt we forwurþað.
WSCp MARK 4.39 & he aras & þam winde bebead & cwæð to ðære sæ,
Suwa & gestille;
